page.title: 06W.CHILTINGTON MEETEN'S MILL
page.content: {Meeten's Mill} was a smock mill and it is now a house.The kitchen used to be a grain store, the window is where the door was for carts to load sacks of flour. The mill used to be in{Monkmead}but it was moved to the{Hollows}by horse and cart in 1830. Three millers owned the mill,{Mr.Hammond, then Mr.Willmer {and Mr.Meeten. { }The mill was made of sandstone for 2 metres and then timber. There was a living room then up some wooden stairs was a bedroom. A door opened onto the catwalk where people could mend or adjust the sails. There are only 2 sails left now. The rooms got smaller and the stairs curved and wound. At the top the rooms sloped inwards. From the attic you could see the sails. Out of a small door was a little raft for the fan.
